title: Biden Hosts Summit for Democracy, But Who’s Invited (and Not) Draws Questions
sub_head: More than 100 democratic governments are attending the virtual gathering intended to showcase democracy’s advantages
body:
President Biden is hosting a virtual gathering of more than 100 democratic governments meant to showcase the benefits of democracy over authoritarianism, though the list of invitees is already straining the effort.
The two-day Summit for Democracy, which opens Thursday, includes not only democratic Western allies, but countries such as the Philippines and Pakistan, which both have been cited by the State Department for “significant human rights issues,” including extrajudicial killings, forced disappearances and torture.
